page.title: 09Farming East of Kingswood
page.content: Gatwick farm is a typical example of the type of{farming}in the area. It is set in a very open area, quite near the small village of Chipstead and is surrounded by fields. The land (of a {chalky}nature) is nearly all given over to rough, arable{grazing}and is used for cattle and horses. Gatwick Farm is not a large one, but it is adequate and manages to cope with the 9_10 acres of land surrounding it. To the rough north_east of Gatwick Farm there is Gatwick wood - a small wood, containing small, deciduous trees. Although the farming is mainly grazing, there is some{hay}grown for winter stores and some{cereal crops are grown. The{equipment}used is quite modern (e.g. tractors and combine harvesters.)There are not many {workers}on the farm, but they manage quite well with their individual jobs.
